intro: Allouya, commonly known as the common mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Allouya is an annual or biennial herb that grows up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and gardens.
